summary: Vonage SMS enables text message notifications for ChurchCRM using the Vonage API (formerly Nexmo). Send SMS alerts to parents when their child checks in via the kiosk system.
requirements: Requires a Vonage account with API access (sign up at https://dashboard.nexmo.com/sign-up), API Key and Secret from Vonage Dashboard, and a phone number provisioned for SMS sending.

sections.title: Current Usage
sections.content: This plugin is currently used for Kiosk Check-in Notifications. When a child is checked into a Sunday School class via the kiosk system, an SMS can be sent to notify parents or guardians.

sections.title: Setup
sections.content:
1. Create a Vonage account at https://dashboard.nexmo.com/sign-up (new accounts include free trial credit)
2. Find your API Key and API Secret on the Vonage Dashboard homepage
3. Go to Numbers > Buy Numbers and purchase a number with SMS capability
4. Note the number in E.164 format (e.g., +14155551234)
5. In ChurchCRM, enable the Vonage SMS plugin and enter your credentials

sections.title: Phone Number Format
sections.content:
Phone numbers should be in E.164 format: country code + number. Examples:
- US: +14155551234
- UK: +447700900123
- Australia: +61412345678

Recipient phone numbers in ChurchCRM member profiles should include the country code for SMS to work correctly.

sections.title: Troubleshooting - SMS Not Sending
sections.content:
If SMS messages aren't being sent:
1. Verify API Key and Secret are correct (no extra spaces)
2. Check that the From Number is a valid Vonage number you own
3. Ensure recipient phone numbers include country code
4. Check your Vonage account balance
5. Review the Vonage Dashboard > SMS > Logs for delivery status

sections.title: Troubleshooting - Invalid Sender ID
sections.content:
If you receive invalid sender ID errors:
1. Use a phone number you've purchased from Vonage
2. Format the number in E.164 format (+14155551234)
3. Note: Alphanumeric sender IDs may be restricted in some countries

sections.title: Troubleshooting - Messages Not Delivered
sections.content:
If messages are sent but not received:
1. Check Vonage Dashboard > SMS > Logs for delivery status
2. Verify the recipient number is correct and can receive SMS
3. Some carriers may block messages from unknown numbers
4. Check if the destination country has SMS restrictions

sections.title: Costs
sections.content: Vonage charges per SMS sent. Pricing varies by destination country. See the Vonage pricing page for current rates. New accounts receive free trial credit for testing.
